formats.name: reverse_advice
formats.instruction: Write one piece of advice you strongly DISAGREE with, then explain why it's flawed. Keep it concise: 2 sentences only.

formats.name: micro_memory
formats.instruction: Describe a tiny, vivid moment from your life that most people would overlook. Use one sentence packed with sensory detail.

formats.name: future_fragment
formats.instruction: Invent a SINGLE sentence prediction about a mundane part of life in 2034. Make it weird, wild, or strangely plausible. No explanation.

formats.name: perspective_switch
formats.instruction: Write about a situation from two radically different perspectives; use two short paragraphs, each under 50 words.

formats.name: unpopular_praise
formats.instruction: Choose something most people dislike, and write a passionate defense in 3 sentences. Be specific about what makes it great.

formats.name: ritual_recipe
formats.instruction: Describe your most idiosyncratic daily ritual, including steps, tools, and why you do it, as a recipe. Use at least three ingredients/actions. 120-180 words.

formats.name: hidden_history
formats.instruction: Reveal a little-known fact or story about a familiar object, tradition, or place, plus how it changes your perception. 180-320 words.

formats.name: contrast_cast
formats.instruction: Pick two opposites (ideas, foods, tech), and argue why the LESS popular one deserves more love. Use 4 bullet points, each under 25 words.

formats.name: metaphor_chain
formats.instruction: Start with an everyday object and create a chain of three metaphors that connect it to something surprising. Write as one flowing paragraph.

formats.name: deep_dive_diagram
formats.instruction: Break down a complex topic with labeled steps or stages. For each, include a mini-paragraph explaining its purpose. Total 300-500 words.

title_styles: Write a title that teases a twist: 'Why X isn't what it seems at first glance'
Use a question with a playful edge: 'Is it possible we've all misunderstood Y?'
Craft a headline centered on discovery: 'What I found in the last place you'd expect'
Frame the topic as a challenge: 'Can you spot the odd truth about Z?'
Begin with a contrast or contradiction: 'The quiet power of loud things'
structure_variants: Write as a mini-script: alternate lines for two characters.
Use three distinct sections, each a different writing style (list, paragraph, analogy).
Start with a vivid image, then expand outward in concentric circles.
Use 'If...then...' chains for every argument or observation.
topic_angles: The weird politics of office coffee

Design flaws nobody notices but you
